generalInfo:
In 17 days we will visit India and Nepal’s most essential destinations including Delhi, Agra, and Jaipur (the Golden Triangle) alongside Varanasi, Lumbini, Kathmandu, Pokhara and Chitwan (Nepal Triangle). We’ll take you on an enchanting adventure to discover the rich, diverse, astounding landscapes of Nepal coupled with the glorious grandeur of India’s famous Golden Triangle trail.

What we promise is the Journey through the region of the world’s tallest mountains and the most visited great wonders of the world.

Our mission is to improve the quality of lives in the communities where we work. Like all of our tours, 80% of the profits fund our NGO based in Mumbai and Delhi. Thank you for supporting our programs by signing up for the tour.

dayInfo.description: Delhi: Welcome to Delhi, the nation’s capital, a vibrant city with an unbelievable amount of history! Your tour guide will meet you at the airport and then you will transfer to your hotel. Depending on your arrival time and how tired you are, the tour guide will plan the rest of the day with you accordingly, which could include some sightseeing plus a welcome dinner.

Delhi: Today you can do any of the city tours or slum tours which we do. We suggest in the morning visiting Sanjay Colony, a small slum built on 25 acres of land located in the south of Delhi near the Bahai Lotus Temple and Iskcon temple. Learn about the working and residential life and witness how despite the challenging living conditions it remains an area charged with positive energy and strong community. You will also learn about the NGO programs directly supported by your visit. In the afternoon we suggest doing some more traditional sightseeing of your choice such as visiting India Gate, Qutub Minar, Humayun’s tomb, Agrasen ki Baoli (a stepwell) and Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, a Sikh temple and one of the largest community kitchens in India which feeds more than 10,000 people per day. In the evening, if you still have the energy, you can explore old Delhi and go on our popular food tour if you wish!

Delhi / Jaipur: We’ll leave Delhi in the morning by car, arrive in Jaipur (5 hrs) by the afternoon, and check in to our hotel. We will then go on an orientation walk around Jaipur, also known as the Pink City of India and you will soon notice this as almost every building within the historic centre is made and painted of pink terracotta colour. Later in the afternoon, we will head to Nahargarh Fort for the stunning sunset view of the pink city

Jaipur: Today we will go on a full day tour of Jaipur. Including the visit to Amber Fort with its magnificent views, and in the afternoon we will continue to explore the rest of the city, such as Hawa Mahal, and Jantar Mantar, and Bapu Bazaar if you wish to do some shopping. There’s also the option to see a Bollywood film at the famous Raj Mandir cinema.

Jaipur /Agra: In the morning, we’ll drive to Agra, home of the Taj Mahal and magnificent Agra Fort. We will arrive in Agra in the afternoon where we’ll check into a family run guest house and head to see the Taj Mahal during the golden light of Sunset. Be amazed by the renowned Mughal architecture and delve into the distinctive history of the mausoleum. Head back to the homestay in the evening after dinner. If you are not tired, have a drink on the rooftop overlooking the Taj!

Agra/Orchha Today, we’ll start our journey with a train ride, heading to Orchha to escape India’s bustling cities and take a glimpse into a rural lifestyle. Once we reach Orchha, we’ll hop on a rickshaw, India’s favorite mode of transportation, to reach the hotel. After checking in, we’ll visit the palace complex to explore the rich ancient history of the region. In the evening, you have the option to witness a Hindu prayer ceremony known as puja – a truly unforgettable experience.

Over night Train to Varanasi: Today’s itinerary includes a visit to a village where we will see a one-of-a-kind paper making plant that was created to empower tribal women from the area. The plant uses recycled clothing and wood pulp to produce all of its paper products. After the visit, you’ll have the rest of the day to explore Orchha at your own pace or learn to cook like a local from a nearby woman. In the evening, we will board an overnight train to Varanasi

Varanasi: This morning, we’ll arrive in Varanasi, the holiest city for Hindus who travel for pilgrimage, worship, mourning, or to die. Upon arrival at the train station, we’ll take you to the hotel. Later, take an orientation walk along the ghats and visit the old city. At sunset, embark on a Ganges boat trip to witness the world’s largest arti ceremony.

Varanasi: Kick off the morning with a breathtaking sunrise boat tour on the sacred Ganges. Afterward, we’ll head back to the hotel to enjoy a delicious breakfast before visiting the magnificent Kashi Vishwanath Temple. The afternoon is yours to explore the winding alleys, visit various temples and shrines, or get lost in the charm of the Old City. Alternatively, you can opt to visit the site of the Buddha’s first sermon or relax by the banks of the Ganges, observing life unfold around you.

Varanasi/Lumbini: Today, we will hit the road early and travel north to cross the border into Nepal. Our destination is Lumbini, the birthplace of Buddha and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This location is not only a popular pilgrimage center, but it’s also teeming with historical significance. We’ll even get the chance to visit the Maya Devi Temple inside the complex, where Queen Maya Devi gave birth to Siddhartha Gautama.

Chitwan National Park: Our journey today will take us through a stunning belt of marshy grasslands, savannas, and forests nestled at the foothills of the Himalayas. This region is teeming with an array of exotic wildlife, including rhinos, elephants, Bengal tigers, bears, and leopards. After a day of exploration, we will be spending the night at an indigenous Tharu community homestay. Here, we can immerse ourselves in their rich culture through traditional dance and song performances.

Chitwan National Park: Join us today for an exciting jeep safari as we explore the diverse ecosystems of the UNESCO Site Chitwan National Park. Afterward, we’ll take a leisurely stroll through the village and rice paddies. In the evening, you’re free to enjoy your own. Later join another night of dance, songs, and traditional Nepalese food with your Tharu community hosts.

Chitwan/ Pokhara: Our journey towards Pokhara will begin in the morning, where we will witness the stunning beauty of the Annapurna Range. Once we arrive in the afternoon, we’ll settle in at the hotel before embarking on an exciting boat ride on Phewa Lake. Known for being home to the 3 tallest mountains in the world, Pokhara is a perfect destination for thrill-seekers and adventure enthusiasts.

Pokhara: Rise and shine at 5 am to witness the breathtaking sunrise from Sarangkot Valley. Take in the picturesque views of the mountainous region that will leave you in awe. After a delicious breakfast, embark on a sightseeing tour of the Gupteshwar (Cave) Temple, Devil’s Fall, Sethi River, and the International Mountain Museum. To add some fun and excitement to the day, we can organize a cricket, football, or volleyball game near the river. Alternatively, take a refreshing swim in the river to cool off.

Pokhara/Kathmandu: Today we drive to Kathmandu (6-7 hrs), on the way we will visit Manakamana Temple, getting there via one of the longest ropeways in the world- we hope you aren’t scared of heights! Upon arriving in the evening in Kathmandu, you’ll have free time to explore and do any last-minute shopping.

Kathmandu: Join us in the morning as we explore some of Kathmandu’s most visited attractions. Our itinerary includes Durbar Square, Kumari Palace, Pashupati Temple, and Swayambhunath Stupa. In addition to these historic landmarks, Kathmandu offers an exciting sensory experience that may be overwhelming to some. The city is bustling with people, sounds, sights, smells, and more.
Departure: Sadly the tour will end today. You can leave anytime after breakfast today back home or to your next destination. We will transfer you to the airport.
